cr-original-review-content (2):
My first Mould King kit and I couldn’t be happier. No missing parts, for the most part a very smooth build. Ran into a few issues with the lower front end. And some of the grill and rear grill plating pieces were extremely loose and needed some glue.
The overall construction was great, sometimes instruction view left you scratching your head, but after a while you understand what you need to do. Most kits I have done there is always a couple of snafus where you have to take apart an assembly to reconstruct it, but that’s part of the hobby and I don’t mind it. That said the build on this was very enjoyable and straightforward. The two sword windshield wipers are a great touch.
This kit when put together, is a great show piece. The wing back tail is iconic for cars if that era. I look forward to building a few more kits I have collected from Mould Kings. And lastly you just can’t beat the price. If this was a Lego kit you would pay minimum twice what it is on sale for. Happy building my friends!
Beautiful when finished, fun build. No missing pieces, great instructions. Will definitely try more Mould King builds in the future. Highly recommend.

Its an amazing build for price, only complaint is the roof isn’t as solid and falls down easy but that can be corrected afterall its exactly like legos and far superior to the old megablocks kits. Also the vehicle height is adjustable front and back by just pulling wheels down in a clicking type of function giving an air ride look

Edit: Their customer service is excellent. They did reach out to correct/replace the missing pieces. For the price point, it is a great set and I do plan to purchase more sets from them.

Great design and decent quality. Only real issue is missing several (8) important pieces. Was able to substitute the missing pieces to finish the build.

Fun & challenging to build!
Not for the beginner.
Loose fitting parts, improper alignment of the back seat, required modification. Otherwise was a good build, three way adjustable suspension is nice, only two missing pieces.

Super gift for the adult car collector. My son has a car that he is is restoring exactly like this one. So this was an awesome gift. He loves it. Great quality. Many small pieces. He had to use tweezers and curved pliers for the super small pieces. I wouldn't recommend this product for children. The pieces do stick together well.
Was a great build looks great with my Lego cars and a third of the price

cr-original-review-content: That my grandson liked his gift!
cr-original-review-content (2): My grandson was absolutely delighted!!! It’s a great idea and he was very happy putting it together and now playing with it!!
The car is great...build was straight forward...only thing the trunk doesn't open by itself...must be removed which makes it pointless having a spare tire in trunk if can't you lift the trunk lid

cr-original-review-content: Nice product, missing pieces, no obvious way to contact seller.
cr-original-review-content (2):
The car (old school Cadillac) looks great. Instructions are good. I've used Mould King in the past and although not to Lego standards, easily worth the kit price (around half of that of a similar Lego set).

This particular set has not been finished, as we are missing two pieces critical to the structure. We can pilfer from the massive bin of broken brick builds, or order from Lego direct - but both methods are hugely time intensive and steal a little thunder from the Christmas Morning build fest! It happens, but I would like to see Mould King / this seller either have obvious contact info or work on quality control.
